all instructions are given assuming right-handed english knitting style k knit p purl pm place marker kfb knit into the front and the back of the stitch 1 stitch increased instructions this hat is knit from the crown to the brim and so you cast on only a few stitches and gradually increase until you have the desired circumference there are two choices of crown a flat simple circle or a knotted i-cord flat circle crown this style uses a circular cast on either emily ocker s or the invisible circular cast on or other circular method of your choice cast on 8 stitches in a circle using the larger of the two needles use a stitch marker to mark the start of round knit 1 round round 2 *kfb pm repeat to end of round 16 stitches continue to crown shaping below i-cord knot crown using the larger needle make a slip knot in such a way that the tail end can be pulled to close the loop round 1 kfb into slip knot do not turn the work but pull your work to the other end of the circular needle and stretch the working yarn behind it as for working i-cord 2 stitches round 2 kfb twice 4 stitches work a 4-stitch i-cord for 8 cm / 3 ¼ mark the start of round with a stitch marker before continuing next round kfb into every stitch 8 stitches knit 1 round next round *kfb pm repeat to end of round 16 stitches continue to crown shaping below crown shaping knit 2 rounds increase round *kfb knit to marker slip marker repeat to end of round next round knit 1 round continue with these two rounds increase round knit round until you have 120 136 152 176 184 200 sts see table of sizes
